title: Law and Covenant Relationship
objective: Explain the function of law within covenant structure

required_passages.text: And Moses came and told the people all the words of the LORD, and all the judgments: and all the people answered with one voice, and said, All the words which the LORD hath said will we do. And Moses wrote all the words of the LORD, and rose up early in the morning, and builded an altar under the hill, and twelve pillars, according to the twelve tribes of Israel. And he sent young men of the children of Israel, which offered burnt offerings, and sacrificed peace offerings of oxen unto the LORD. And Moses took half of the blood, and put it in basons; and half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar. And he took the book of the covenant, and read in the audience of the people: and they said, All that the LORD hath said will we do, and be obedient. And Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, Behold, the blood of the covenant, which the LORD hath made with you concerning all these words. And he took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, Behold, the blood of the covenant, which the LORD hath made with you concerning all these words.

Israel accepts covenant stipulations. The people respond in covenant commitment. Blood seals the covenant. This is covenant ratification ceremony establishing reciprocal obligation.
Law functions within covenant as stipulation. It defines covenant membership and obligation. Obedience maintains covenant relationship. Disobedience brings judgment. Law is relational not abstract.

Key themes: covenant stipulations govern relationship. Law preserves covenantal order. Obedience is response to grace. Judgment for disobedience is covenant discipline. Law should be loved not feared.
This completes lesson twelve. You studied law and covenant relationship. Next lesson examines the tabernacle as covenant meeting place.

vocabulary.definition: Specific obligations and conditions governing a covenant relationship
Human response to covenant stipulations maintaining the covenantal relationship

study_notes: Understanding law within covenant context prevents misinterpretation. Law is not about earning salvation but maintaining covenant relationship with God.
